caption.p: List of plants evaluated for acaricidal/repellent properties against Hyalomma species.

tr.th: Part of plant and solvent used

tr.td: Artemisia herba alba Asso (Asteraceae)
Diethyl ether (DE), ethyl acetate (EA), hexane, and ethanol extracts of aerial parts
Against larvae LC 50 = 0.0296 μg/μl (DE), 0.0022 μg/μl (EA), 0.369 μg/μl (hexane) and 0.018 μg/μl (ethanol)
A. herba alba (Asteraceae)
aerial parts
LC 50 = 1.105 (eggs), 0.755 (larvae) and 0.0079 μL/mL (nymphs)
A. monosperma Del. (Tarragon)
Diethyl ether (DE), ethyl acetate (EA), hexane, and ethanol extracts of aerial parts
Against larvae LC 50 = 0.0952 μg/μl (DE), 0.0636 μg/μl (EA), 0.0437 μg/μl (hexane) and 0.252 μg/μl (ethanol)
Azadirachta indica (Meliaceae)
NeemAzal F (Commercial product prepared from seed)
A. indica A Juss (Meliaceae)
Neem oil and azadirachtin essential oil formulation
Significant effect on larva feeding, molting of nymph and molt ability at 2.5 μg/mL azadirachtin; Against adult contact LC50 is > 40.7 μg cm −2 and against larvae dipping LC 50 = 5.0 μg/mL
Calotropis procera (Asclepiadaceae)
A cardiac glycosidal (cardenolide) extract
Against larvae contact LC 50 = 9.63 μg/cm 2 and dipping LC 50 = 1.096 μg/mL
Ethanolic extracts of leaves
Against larvae LC 50 (leaves extracts) = 0.14 %
Digitalis purpurea L. (Scrophulariaceae)
A cardiac glycosidal (digitoxin) extract
Against larvae contact LC 50 = 4.08 μg/cm 2 and dipping LC 50 = 0.410 μg/mL.
Eucalyptus camaldulensis Dehnh (river red gum)
Essential oil from leaves and flowering tops through hydrodistillation
100 % inhibition of reproduction of female at 6.250 μl/ml; Against larvae LC 50 = 0.207 μl/ml, LC 90 = 1.653 μl/ml and LC 95 = 2.978 μl/ml)
E. globulus Labill (blue gum)
Essential oil from leaves and flowering tops through hydrodistillation
100 % inhibition of the reproduction in female at 6.250 μl/ml; Against larvae LC 50 = 0.155 μl/ml, LC 90 = 2.387 μl/ml and LC 95 = 5.183 μl/ml
dichloromethane extract of plant
Significant repellent effects against adults (30–40 % of extract up to 120 min)
Euphorbia aegyptiaca (Euphorbiaceae)
Diethyl ether (DE), ethyl acetate (EA), hexane, and ethanol extracts of aerial parts
Against larvae LC 50 = 0.2595 μg/μl (DE), 1.511 μg/μl (EA), 0.763 μg/μl (hexane) and 0.6117 μg/μl (ethanol).
Francoeuria crispa (Asteraceae)
Diethyl ether (DE), ethyl acetate (EA), hexane, and ethanol extracts of aerial parts
Against larvae LC 50 = 1.069 μg/μl (DE), 0.455 μg/μl (EA), 0.849 μg/μl (hexane) and 0.656 μg/μl (ethanol).
Geranium macrorrhizum (Geraniaceae)
Essential oils through hydrodistillation of arial part
Against larvae LC 50 = 1.37 mg/ml and LC 90 = 2.87 mg/mL
Guierase negalensis (Combrataceae)
Leaves, Petroleum ether PE) and ethanolic extracts (EE)
Haplophyllum tuberculatum (Rutaceae)
Essential oils from aerial parts
Against larvae LC 50 = 0.5 %
Lavandula stoechas L. (lavender)
Essential oil from leaves and flowering tops through hydrodistillation
100 % inhibition of reproduction at 3.125 μl/ml; Against larvae LC 50 = 0.253 μl/ml, LC 90 = 2.212 μl/ml, and LC 95 = 4.092 μl/ml
Mesembryanthemus forsskale (Aizoaceae)
Diethyl ether (DE), ethyl acetate (EA), hexane, and ethanol extracts of aerial parts
Against larvae LC 50 = 0.611 μg/μl (DE), 1.646 μg/μl (EA), 0.294 μg/μl (hexane) and 0.380 μg/μl (ethanol).
Ethyl-acetate extract of plant
Significant repellent effects on adult tick (40% v/w of extract for the first 40 min).
Origanum floribundum Munby (oregano)
Essential oil from leaves and flowering tops through hydrodistillation
100 % inhibition of reproduction at 3.125 μl/ml; Against larvae LC 50 = 0.131 μl/ml, LC 90 = 0.982 μl/ml, and LC 95 = 1.740 μl/ml
Reaumuria hirtella (Tamaricaceae)
Diethyl ether (DE), ethyl acetate (EA), hexane, and ethanol extracts of aerial parts
Against larvae LC 50 = 124.68 μg/μl (DE), 16.417 μg/μl (EA), 8.382 μg/μl (hexane) and 23676.62 μg/μl (ethanol).
Rosmarinus officinalis L. (rosemary)
Essential oil from leaves and flowering tops through hydrodistillation
100 % inhibition of reproduction at 0.781 μl/ml; Against larvae LC 50 = 0.108 μl/ml, LC 90 = 0.495 μl/ml, and LC 95 = 0.761 μl/ml
SaturejathymbraL. (Lamiaceae)
Volatile essential oil collected from arial part of plant at flowering stage through hydrodistillation
100 % adult tick mortality in 3 h at 40 μl/L
Senna italica subsp. arachoides (Fabaceae)
Ethyl acetate extract of root
Against adult LC 50 = 8.66 % (w/v) in 24 h and 3.59 % (w/v) in 48 h
Tagetes minuta L. (Asteraceae)
Essential oil from aerial parts and flowers
Repellent EC 50 for male ticks = 0.072 mL/mL and for female = 0.070 mL/mL; Significant number of nymphs (60%) delayed in moulting
Thymus capitatus L. (thyme)
Essential oil from leaves and flowering tops through hydrodistillation
100 % inhibit the reproduction in femaleat 1.562 μl/ml; Against larvae LC 50 = 0.058 μl/ml, LC 90 = 0.358 μl/ml, and LC 95 = 0.600 μl/ml
Ethanolic extracts of leaves and roots
Against larvae LC 50 (root extract) = 1.27 % and (leaves extract) = 0.011 %
Ethanolic extracts of leaves
Against larvae LC 50 (ethanolic extracts) = 10.12 %
